flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
I got tired of constantly having to to LAN parties in the same backpack I use to go to school everyday. After spending all of college using that backpack, the wear and tear finally gave out one day with my Xbox in it and it fell down the stairs at my apartment complex.

I decided that enough was enough and decided to invest in a hard cases. However, what I found was that there wasn't a case specifically build for carrying a game system. Luckily, the cases at Ralph's come with custom foam inserts that allow you to manipulate the foam and securely fit my Xbox in there.

I ended up going with the Pelican 1490 case because of an article I found on the Ralph's web site. I loosely followed the directions and made my own personal case, but it wasn't a bad template to work off of.

guide.summary: I took a Pelican 1490 case that I bought online from Ralph's Pelican Cases and turned into a portable Xbox case. It doesn't have a power source, but since I travel a lot, it's very helpful.
